description: Creates a new table associated with the given namespace in a table bucket. For more information, see Creating an Amazon S3 table in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

parameters.name: tableBucketARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the table bucket to create the table in.

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: The namespace to associated with the table.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: The metadata for the table. iceberg (dict) --- Contains details about the metadata of an Iceberg table. The schema for an Iceberg table. The schema fields for the table (dict) --- Contains details about a schema field. The name of the field. The field type. S3 Tables supports all Apache Iceberg primitive types. For more information, see the Apache Iceberg documentation. required (boolean) --- A Boolean value that specifies whether values are required for each row in this field. By default, this is false and null values are allowed in the field. If this is true the field does not allow null values.

nested_params.name: iceberg
nested_params.description: Contains details about the metadata of an Iceberg table.

nested_params.name: schema
nested_params.description: The schema for an Iceberg table.

nested_params.name: fields
nested_params.description: The schema fields for the table.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The field type. S3 Tables supports all Apache Iceberg primitive types. For more information, see the Apache Iceberg documentation.

nested_params.name: required
nested_params.description: A Boolean value that specifies whether values are required for each row in this field. By default, this is false and null values are allowed in the field. If this is true the field does not allow null values.

parameters.name: encryptionConfiguration
parameters.description: The encryption configuration to use for the table. This configuration specifies the encryption algorithm and, if using SSE-KMS, the KMS key to use for encrypting the table. The server-side encryption algorithm to use. Valid values are AES256 for S3-managed encryption keys, or aws:kms for Amazon Web Services KMS-managed encryption keys. If you choose SSE-KMS encryption you must grant the S3 Tables maintenance principal access to your KMS key. For more information, see Permissions requirements for S3 Tables SSE-KMS encryption. kmsKeyArn (string) --- The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption. This field is required only when sseAlgorithm is set to aws:kms.

nested_params.name: sseAlgorithm
nested_params.description: The server-side encryption algorithm to use. Valid values are AES256 for S3-managed encryption keys, or aws:kms for Amazon Web Services KMS-managed encryption keys. If you choose SSE-KMS encryption you must grant the S3 Tables maintenance principal access to your KMS key. For more information, see Permissions requirements for S3 Tables SSE-KMS encryption.

nested_params.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key to use for encryption. This field is required only when sseAlgorithm is set to aws:kms.

nested_items.name: tableARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the table.

nested_items.name: versionToken
nested_items.description: The version token of the table.
